Description: Reconstructed sherds of Clazomenian black-figure painted pottery neck-amphora; Body: (a) Four female figures processing to right with long hair, fillets, necklaces, long chitons, and himatia. (b) Similar design. Below, a guilloche border and a frieze of Sirens to left, of which parts of four are visible; they have long hair, fillets, and wings back-to-back. Purple on fillets of women and sirens, alternately on chiton and cloak of women, on forepart of wing of sirens.
Curator's comments: reconstructed with BM GR 1888.2-8.75.d The fragments are not certainly all from one pot. BMC B.i 12. BSA xlvii, 128-B.2. Compare BM GR 1888,0208.71.a
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B112)
CVA British Museum 8 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 13, British Museum 8 (Pl. GB 584, 4)
Weber 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus anderen ägyptischen Fundorten (TD 117)
